nodes.description: 2001年11月，西班牙警方逮捕了被认为是基地组织欧洲头目Abu Dahdah及其同伙
nodes.support_text: the man considered to be al-Qa'ida's leader in Europe, Eddin Barakat Yarkas, alias Abu Dahdah, and other al-Qa'ida members were detained in Spain after the 11 September attacks

nodes.description: 2003年10月，本拉登通过半岛电视台发表电视讲话，威胁对参与伊拉克战争的西班牙等国采取行动
nodes.support_text: Bin Laden's televised message transmitted by al-Jazeera television Bin Laden said: "We reserve the right to respond at the opportune time and place in all the countries that are participating in this unjust war, in particular United Kingdom, Spain [and other countries]"

nodes.description: 2004年3月11日，西班牙马德里发生 commuter trains连环爆炸，造成191人死亡、1820人受伤
nodes.support_text: The seven suspects accused of masterminding the Madrid train bombings of 11 March 2004

nodes.description: 2004年4月左右，七名主要嫌疑人因警方突袭其在Leganes的藏身处而自杀身亡
nodes.support_text: Seven alleged ringleaders ... blew themselves up three weeks after the train bombings when police laid siege to their apartment hideout in the Madrid suburb of Leganes

nodes.description: 2006年11月6日，埃及嫌疑人Rabei Osman在意大利米兰因恐怖主义指控被判刑10年
nodes.support_text: Osman, who is accused of having bragged that the train bombings were his idea, is expected to be extradited to face trial in Spain

nodes.description: 2006年11月7日，西班牙检方正式提出对七名主谋的刑期诉求，总计每名38,490年
nodes.support_text: The state prosecutor, Olga Sanchez, said the suspected ringleaders should face prison terms of 30 years for each of the 191 victims... The combined sentence requested amounts to 38,490 years for each suspect

nodes.description: 2006年，马德里火车爆炸案审判准备工作就绪，计划于2007年春季开庭审理
nodes.support_text: The prosecutor's office will call on 134 witnesses and 67 experts... during the trial which is expected to begin next spring

nodes.description: 2003年10月，电视讲话激发袭击事件
nodes.support_text: 袭击事件受电视讲话启发

nodes.description: We保留对参与国采取回应的权利
nodes.support_text: 保留在参战国采取回应权利
